thread.title: Tiger v-ball finishes third at SEISC tourney
thread.title_full: Tiger v-ball finishes third at SEISC tourney

author: news@mpnews.net (Staff)
title: Tiger v-ball finishes third at SEISC tourney
text:
Tiger v-ball finishes third at SEISC tourney Sep 29, 2015 
BY ANDY KRUTSINGER 
Mt. Pleasant News 
BURLINGTON â€” The 11th-ranked New London volleyball team competed at the SEISC tournament finals on Saturday night. The Tigers advanced to the semi-finals with a 2-0 win over Highland, before falling, 2-0, to No. 4 Holy Trinity to drop to the third-place game. The Tigers went on to defeat Pekin to wrap up a third-place finish. 
In the quarterfinals, New London disposed of Highland, 25-15 and 25-6 in straight sets. Breanna Mettler and Brandi Allen led the team with three kills apiece. Mettler also led the team with four aces. Emma Pry had 13 assists and 12 digs. 
The Tigers suffered yet another close loss to HTC in the semi-finals, falling 25-17 in the first game and 25-19 in the second. Mettler finished with seven kills to lead New London, and Allen and Josten Boyer had four apiece. Boyer also had four blocks. Carson McSorely led in kills with 15 and Pry had 18 assists. 
New London bounced back in the third-place game against Pekin. The Tigers dropped the Panthers 25-18 in the first game, and held on for a 25-23 win in the second to wrap up third place. Mettler had nine kills and Allen had six in the win. Pry had another big game with 19 assists and 13 digs and Kenadi Schulte had three blocks. 
Mediapolis ran away with the championship with a 2-0 win over HTC in the championship game (25-16 and 25-15). The Crusaders were forced to settle for second place. 
Meanwhile, in the consolation bracket, Winfield-Mt. Union went 3-0 with wins over Lone Tree (21-14 and 21-17), Wapello (21-12, 17-21, 21-19) and IMS (21-18 and 21-15). WACO went 1-2 in the consolation bracket. The Warriors beat Columbus (21-14, 15-21, 15-12), but fell to Lone Tree (19-21, 21-14, 15-13) and Wapello (21-13 and 22-20).
